headline: The Day Pharma’s Weight-Loss Gold Rush Intensified

headline: Health Care Roundup: Market Talk
summary: 1329 ET – Eli Lilly’s direct channel sales are reducing obstacles to access GLP-1 drugs, helping it grow the total market, the company says on its analyst call.  “There is significant demand in the consumer segment related to finding ways to get outside some of the frictions in the health care system,” Lily USA President  Ilya Yuffa  says.  “We’re seeing significantly more volume go through a direct-to-consumer platform with Lilly Direct.”

content.title: Health Care Roundup: Market Talk
content.summary: 1329 ET – Eli Lilly’s direct channel sales are reducing obstacles to access GLP-1 drugs, helping it grow the total market, the company says on its analyst call.  “There is significant demand in the consumer segment related to finding ways to get outside some of the frictions in the health care system,” Lily USA President  Ilya Yuffa  says.  “We’re seeing significantly more volume go through a direct-to-consumer platform with Lilly Direct.”

headline: Eli Lilly teams up with Walmart on Zepbound: CFO explains
summary: Eli Lilly (LLY) stock rises after reporting that sales of its weight-loss drugs more than doubled in the third quarter. The pharmaceutical company also announced a partnership with Walmart (WMT) to make GLP-1s more accessible to consumers. Eli Lilly CFO Lucas Montarce joins Market Catalysts to discuss the pharmaceutical giant's earnings print and its Walmart partnership. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

Eli Lilly CFO Lucas Montarce joins Market Catalysts to discuss the pharmaceutical giant's earnings print and its Walmart partnership.

headline: Obesity, diabetes treatments fuel Eli Lilly growth and spark bidding war
summary: Lilly said Thursday that its top-selling drugs, Mounjaro and Zepbound, brought in more than $10 billion combined during the recently completed third quarter.  Separately, Danish drugmaker Novo Nordisk announced plans to buy Metsera Inc. in a deal that could be worth up to $9 billion.

content.title: Obesity, diabetes treatments fuel Eli Lilly growth and spark bidding war
content.summary: Lilly said Thursday that its top-selling drugs, Mounjaro and Zepbound, brought in more than $10 billion combined during the recently completed third quarter.  Separately, Danish drugmaker Novo Nordisk announced plans to buy Metsera Inc. in a deal that could be worth up to $9 billion.

headline: AI boom drives trillion-dollar tech valuations and record bets on chipmakers
summary: Nvidia’s shares jumped nearly 11% over the past month, adding about $500 billion in market value as it became the first company to reach a $5 trillion valuation.  Chief Executive Jensen Huang this week announced $500 billion in AI chip orders and plans to build seven supercomputers for the U.S. government.  Broadcom gained 17% over the past month to reach a $1.82 trillion valuation, while TSMC added 15% to $1.28 trillion and Alphabet climbed 13% to $3.32 trillion.

content.title: AI boom drives trillion-dollar tech valuations and record bets on chipmakers
content.summary: Nvidia’s shares jumped nearly 11% over the past month, adding about $500 billion in market value as it became the first company to reach a $5 trillion valuation.  Chief Executive Jensen Huang this week announced $500 billion in AI chip orders and plans to build seven supercomputers for the U.S. government.  Broadcom gained 17% over the past month to reach a $1.82 trillion valuation, while TSMC added 15% to $1.28 trillion and Alphabet climbed 13% to $3.32 trillion.

headline: Eli Lilly Stock Rises on Earnings as Investors Await Trump Drug Pricing Deal
summary: The company posted adjusted earnings of $7.02 a share, compared with the $5.89 forecast by analysts, according to FactSet.  Lilly now says it expects non-GAAP earnings from $23 to $23.70 a share this year, up from $21.75 to $23.  The new guidance is well above the current analyst consensus estimate of $22.48, and suggests Wall Street’s fourth quarter expectations may be too low.

content.title: Eli Lilly Stock Rises on Earnings as Investors Await Trump Drug Pricing Deal
content.summary: The company posted adjusted earnings of $7.02 a share, compared with the $5.89 forecast by analysts, according to FactSet.  Lilly now says it expects non-GAAP earnings from $23 to $23.70 a share this year, up from $21.75 to $23.  The new guidance is well above the current analyst consensus estimate of $22.48, and suggests Wall Street’s fourth quarter expectations may be too low.

headline: Novo Nordisk launches bidding war with Pfizer for obesity drugmaker Metsera
summary: Danish pharmaceutical giant Novo Nordisk, maker of weight-loss drugs Ozempic and Wegovy, announced Thursday an unsolicited bid to acquire obesity treatment maker Metsera, topping an offer from US rival Pfizer which called the move "reckless".Pfizer called Novo Nordisk's offer a "reckless and unprecedented proposal".

content.title: Novo Nordisk launches bidding war with Pfizer for obesity drugmaker Metsera
content.summary: Danish pharmaceutical giant Novo Nordisk, maker of weight-loss drugs Ozempic and Wegovy, announced Thursday an unsolicited bid to acquire obesity treatment maker Metsera, topping an offer from US rival Pfizer which called the move "reckless".Pfizer called Novo Nordisk's offer a "reckless and unprecedented proposal".

thumbnail.caption: Novo Nordisk, maker of Ozempic and Wegovy, made an offer valuing Metsera at $6 billion (Mads Claus Rasmussen)

headline: Lilly hikes revenue forecasts on booming obesity drug sales
summary: Tirzepatide, which Lilly sells as Mounjaro for diabetes and Zepbound for obesity, topped $10 billion in the third-quarter, officially becoming the world’s best-selling drug.

content.summary: Tirzepatide, which Lilly sells as Mounjaro for diabetes and Zepbound for obesity, topped $10 billion in the third-quarter, officially becoming the world’s best-selling drug.

headline: Eli Lilly (NYSE:LLY) Delivers Strong Q3 Numbers, Stock Soars
summary: Global pharmaceutical company Eli Lilly (NYSE:LLY) reported revenue ahead of Wall Streets expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 53.9% year on year to $17.6 billion. The company’s full-year revenue guidance of $63.25 billion at the midpoint came in 2.6% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $7.02 per share was 18.6% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Eli Lilly (NYSE:LLY) Delivers Strong Q3 Numbers, Stock Soars
content.summary: Global pharmaceutical company Eli Lilly (NYSE:LLY) reported revenue ahead of Wall Streets expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 53.9% year on year to $17.6 billion. The company’s full-year revenue guidance of $63.25 billion at the midpoint came in 2.6% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $7.02 per share was 18.6% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Lilly: Q3 Earnings Snapshot
summary: INDIANAPOLIS (AP) — Eli Lilly and Co. (LLY) on Thursday reported third-quarter profit of $5.58 billion. The Indianapolis-based company said it had net income of $6.21 per share. Earnings, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, were $7.02 per share.

content.title: Lilly: Q3 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: INDIANAPOLIS (AP) — Eli Lilly and Co. (LLY) on Thursday reported third-quarter profit of $5.58 billion. The Indianapolis-based company said it had net income of $6.21 per share. Earnings, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, were $7.02 per share.
